pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:0.4_0: The training rule on indecent speech
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.10_0: But, after leaving, those among them who had a sense of shame complained to the monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.12_0: We wouldn’t want to hear this from our own husbands, let alone from Venerable Udāyī.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.4_0: On one occasion a number of women came to the monastery to see the dwellings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.7_0: “Venerable, we would like to see your dwelling.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.8_0: Then, after showing them his own dwelling, he praised and disparaged their private parts; he requested and implored, asked and enquired, described, instructed, and abused.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.1.9_0: Those women among them who were shameless scoundrels flirted with Udāyī; they called out to him, laughed with him, and teased him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.10_0: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.11_0: for the stilling of the fever for sense pleasures?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.12_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.13_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.14.1_0: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, speaks indecent words connected with sexual intercourse to a woman, as a young man might to a young woman, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.1_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.2_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī speak indecently to women?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.3_0: They rebuked Udāyī in many ways and told the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.4_0: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.5_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you spoke indecently to women?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.8_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it should not to be done.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:1.2.9_0: How can you speak indecently to women?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.11_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.11_1: and what is indecent and what is decent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.13_0: speech connected with the anus, the vagina, or sexual intercourse.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.15_0: one living in a monastery is what is meant.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.16_0: As a young man might to a young woman:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.17_0: a male youth to a female youth, a boy to a girl, a male who indulges in worldly pleasures to a female who indulges in worldly pleasures.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.21_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “un offense entailing suspension”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.6_0: in love with the meaning, the teaching that has not been in love.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.8_0: A desiring mind is distorted; an angry mind is distorted; a deluded mind is distorted.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:2.9_0: but still has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.12_0: “When will there be a good opportunity, a good time, a good moment?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.13_0: “When will I have sexual intercourse with you?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.15_0: saying, “How do you give to your husband?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.16_0: “How do you give to your lover?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.18_0: saying, “So you give to your husband like this,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.19_0: and to your lover like this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.1_0: Referring to the anus or the vagina, he praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, abuses.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.21_0: having been asked, he says, “Give like this.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.23_0: not having been asked, he says, “Give like this. My husband is dear and beloved to him.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.3_0: extols, praises, commends the two private orifices.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.5_0: despises, reviles, censures the the anus or the vagina.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.7_0: saying, “Give to me; you should to give to me.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.1.9_0: saying, “When will you please your mother?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.10_0: abuses, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.1_0: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.2_0: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of a woman, praises, disparages, requests, implores, asks, enquires, describes, instructs, and abuses.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.4.1_0: It is two women, but he perceives them as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.5_0: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both women, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.6_0: abuses, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.8.1_0: It is a woman and a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.2.9_0: If the monk, referring to the anus or the vagina of both of them, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.1_0: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.2_0: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.3_0: abuses, he commits a serious offense. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.4_0: It is two women, but he perceives them as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.5_0: If the monk, referring to any part of both women below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.6_0: abuses, he commits two serious offenses. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.7_0: It is a woman and a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.8_0: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them below the collar bone but above the knees, apart from the anus or the vagina, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.3.9_0: abuses, he commits one serious offense and one offense of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.1_0: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.2_0: If the monk, referring to any part of the woman above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.3_0: abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.4_0: It is two women, but he perceives them as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.5_0: If the monk, referring to any part of both women above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.6_0: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.7_0: It is a woman and a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.8_0: If the monk, referring to any part of both of them above the collar bone or below the knees, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.4.9_0: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.1_0: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.2_0: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the woman’s body, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.3_0: abuses, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.4_0: It is two women, but he perceives them as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.5_0: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both women, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.6_0: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.7_0: It is a woman and a _paṇḍaka_, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.8_0: If the monk, referring to anything connected to the body of both of them, praises, disparages ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.5.9_0: abuses, he commits two offenses of wrong conduct. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.10_0: I hope the path has an end,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.11_0: Faith, with a gift, with work.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.2_0: At the fore of the third,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:3.6.3_0: at the fore of the Teaching,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.1_0: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly woven cloak of wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a newly dyed woolen cloak.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.1.6_0: He became anxious and thought, “The Buddha has laid down a training rule. Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing suspension?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.10_0: The third rule, the training rule on indecent speech, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.1_0: At one time a woman was doing a legal procedure.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.10.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.1_0: At one time a certain woman was wearing a cloak of coarse wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.2.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a cloak of coarse wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.1_0: At one time a certain woman was wearing a newly woven cloak of wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.3.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a newly woven cloak of wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.1_0: At one time a certain woman was wearing a cloak of coarse wool.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.4.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a cloak of coarse wool.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.1_0: At one time a certain woman was wearing a fleecy upper robe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.5.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, it’s a fleecy upper robe.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.1_0: At one time a woman was returning after having had a field sown.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.2_0: A lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.6.5_0: “Yes, Venerable, but the furrow isn’t yet closed yet.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.1_0: At one time a monk saw a female wanderer coming in the opposite direction and, being lustful, he said to her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.7.2_0: “Sister, I hope the path has an end?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.1_0: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.3_0: but you don’t give us what you give your husband.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.8.7_0: He said, “You have committed an offense entailing suspension.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.1_0: At one time a lustful monk said to a woman,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.3_0: yet you don’t give us the highest gift.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss3:4.9.7_0: He said, “You have committed an offense entailing suspension.”
